SG Maths Tuition

    Maths Tuition by Ph.D. holder

    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one and Small Group classes
    • Personalised lesson plans
    • University, JC, E/A maths
    • Latest MOE Syllabus + IP + IB
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    About The Tutor

    Greetings! This is Dr Ng, a dedicated private tutor in Singapore, specializing in Mathematics for Junior College and Upper Secondary, as well as Mathematics and Statistics at the University level.

    I strive to create a learning environment that is both enjoyable and enriching, ensuring that every student has a fulfilling educational experience.

    More than 80 percent of my students have seen at least a two grade improvement after just a few months of tuition. Many have achieved distinctions in their final examinations.

    Academic Qualifications

    • Ph.D (Mathematics) from National University of Singapore
    • B.Sc. (Honours - First Class) from National University of Singapore

    Experience

    • Full time tutor since 2010
    • Both tuition centre and home-based
    • Well-versed with latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus

    Various Levels Taught

    University Maths

    Mathematics at University and Polytechnic level is extremely broad in scope. I cover Probability & Statistics, Calculus of Several Variables, Linear Algebra, Analysis, Abstract Algebra, and Discrete Mathematics for Year 1 and 2.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Junior College Maths

    Junior College (JC) Mathematics is where I have the most extensive experience. I provide focused tracks for H2/H1 Mathematics, H3 Mathematics, and H2 Further Mathematics -- all latest MOE syllabus.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Secondary Level

    I tutor both Elementary Maths and Additional Maths for G3 and G2 students (latest MOE syllabus) and also provide coverage for Integrated Programme (IP).

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Testimonials

      Contact

      Contact Information

      Complete the form or connect with me directly using the details below.

      DN
      Dr Ng
      Founder & Tutor
      SG Maths Tuition
      WhatsApp +65 9299 7306
      Email Me
      integrated.math.tuition@gmail.com
      5-minute walk from Kovan MRT
      Programme I'm interested in
      Singapore numbers only.
      0 of 600 characters

thoughts.content: To adjust the hero section for screen widths between 800-1199px, you could use a media query targeting that range. Consider tweaking the “min-height” property to a smaller value, like `clamp(350px, 50vw, 500px)`. To reduce the gap between the header and the content, set top margin and padding on the content sections.

To reduce the hero section's height and gaps, start by adjusting the `min-height` clamp value to be slightly smaller, like `clamp(350px, 50vw, 500px)`. For padding, reduce both the top and bottom padding of `.hero-content` and consider tweaking margins on `.hero` or inner sections. For better spacing, adjust the padding of `.section:first-child` to decrease the gap between the hero and content.

To reduce the gap between the hero section and the next section, we can adjust the top padding of the following `.section` (currently 36px). Since `.hero-content` doesn’t affect the gap below it, modifying `.section:first-of-type` margin or padding can help. For narrower tablets, tweaking the padding further might also be useful.

To reduce the gaps:

- Adjust the gap between the sticky header and the hero text by tweaking the `.hero-content` padding-top and setting `align-items: flex-start` to move the content closer to the top.
- For the gap between the hero text and the "About The Tutor" section, reduce the hero’s bottom margin or consider adjusting `.section:first-of-type` padding-top to 36px.

To reduce the gap, I can adjust the `.hero` min-height to something like `clamp(300px, 40vw, 480px)` for mid-screen widths (800-1199px). This should bring the height closer to the image's size. Also, reduce `.hero-content` padding-top and padding-bottom for smaller gap. For the internal children, I'll tweak the gap property slightly, reducing the vertical space.

thoughts.summary: Adjusting the hero section height and spacing
thoughts.content: To reduce the hero's height, I can adjust its min-height with `clamp(320px, 40vw, 480px)` for widths 800-1199px. Additionally, aligning items to `flex-start` will help lift the content. I'll also modify padding and gap properties to tighten spacing, ensuring the overall height is smaller without significant changes to font sizes or margins that weren’t explicitly specified.

thoughts.summary: Reducing hero section height and spacing
thoughts.content: To reduce the hero section's height between 800–1199px, I'll implement a media query that adjusts various CSS properties like `min-height`, `padding`, and `gap` to ensure a tighter vertical rhythm without adding extra classes. The adjustments aim for better alignment and less spacing, while maintaining your existing breakpoints.

thoughts.content: To make the image fill the height of the hero section, I'll use `object-fit: cover` with width set to 100% and height 100%. I'll also need to adjust the positioning of `.hero-media` by setting it absolute, covering the section fully. To ensure the text overlay appears correctly, I'll need to tweak the CSS too, since the image is in the normal flow right now.

content.text:
css = Path('/mnt/data/tuition-css-1.0.0.css').read_text()
# find hero CSS
import re
for sel in ['.hero', '.hero-media', '.hero-content', '.hero-title']:
    m = re.search(re.escape(sel)+r'[^}]*}', css)
    print(sel, bool(m))
print(css[:1500])

# Find where these 420px rules occur to see media query blocks
indexes = [m.start() for m in re.finditer(r'\.hero\s*{\s*height:\s*420px;', css)]
for i in indexes:
    start = css.rfind('@media', 0, i)
    print("Found at", i, "in media starting at", start, css[start:start+200])

thoughts.summary: Adjusting hero image for full height
thoughts.content: I'll modify the CSS to make the image fill the height of the hero section. By adding `height: 100%` and `object-fit: cover` to `.hero-media` and its image, plus setting `.hero-media` to `height: 100%` to ensure proper stretching, I’ll ensure the image fills the whole area. Also, I'll set `.hero` to `position: relative` for proper layout.

The `` inside `` has inline styles that override my CSS, so I’ll use `!important` to make sure my styling sticks. I’ll set both `width: 100%` and `height: 100%` to ensure the image covers the container. I’ll also ensure that responsive sources are correctly handled when the screen width is >=1440.

I’ll keep the `<picture>` for responsive image sources while using `srcset` for different screen sizes (like `1440px`). For better control over positioning, I’ll ensure the text overlays properly by setting `z-index: 2` for `.hero-content` while keeping the image behind with no `z-index`. The object-fit property will take care of aspect ratio.

To ensure the image crops correctly across all sizes, I'll stretch `.hero-media` with `align-self: stretch` and `justify-self: stretch`. I'll keep `height: 100%` on `.hero-media` to make it fill the container, and set `object-position: center` to avoid shifting. Also, I'll add `pointer-events: none` to `<picture>` to prevent interference with clicks.

thoughts.summary: Final CSS solution for hero layout
